channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Venezuelans describe the day after U.S. strikes
item.description: A day after Saturday's U.S. strikes, Venezuelans describe fear, confusion, and long lines for fuel and food.
item.content:encoded: A day after Saturday's U.S. strikes, Venezuelans describe fear, confusion, and long lines for fuel and food.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Miami mayor calls for Trump to 'immediately' reinstate TPS for Venezuelans
item.description: Higgins said the Trump administration ending TPS for Venezuelans in early 2025 was "reckless, dangerous, and wrong."
item.content:encoded:
Higgins said the Trump administration ending TPS for Venezuelans in early 2025 was "reckless, dangerous, and wrong."

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Nicolás Maduro will appear in U.S. federal court on Monday
item.description: The Venezuelan president, who was captured by U.S. forces early Saturday, is awaiting trial in New York City on federal criminal charges.
item.content:encoded:
The Venezuelan president, who was captured by U.S. forces early Saturday, is awaiting trial in New York City on federal criminal charges.

(Image credit: Adam Gray)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Covering US-Russian relations and a rapidly changing wartime Russia
item.description: NPR's Charles Maynes in Moscow on how the White House's Russia rhetoric shifted this year and how it is landing in Moscow.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Charles Maynes in Moscow on how the White House's Russia rhetoric shifted this year and how it is landing in Moscow.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Even in prison, Marwan Barghouthi looms large in Palestinian politics
item.description: Arab Barghouthi, the son of Palestinian leader Marwan Barghouthi, on his father's life in Israeli prison and the stalemate after nearly two decades without elections.
item.content:encoded: Arab Barghouthi, the son of Palestinian leader Marwan Barghouthi, on his father's life in Israeli prison and the stalemate after nearly two decades without elections.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Who's in charge in Venezuela now?
item.description: Who is in charge in Venezuela after the US seized and ousted its president? Manuel Rueda reports from Bogotá, Colombia.
item.content:encoded: Who is in charge in Venezuela after the US seized and ousted its president? Manuel Rueda reports from Bogotá, Colombia.
item.dc:creator: Manuel Rueda

item.title: Rubio says there's 'not a war against Venezuela' despite U.S. capture of Maduro
item.description: Top Democrat calls operation 'a violation of the law' and promises Senate vote on President Trump's war powers.
item.content:encoded:
Top Democrat calls operation 'a violation of the law' and promises Senate vote on President Trump's war powers.

(Image credit: Molly Riley)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Denmark's prime minister says 'stop the threats' of U.S. annexing Greenland
item.description: The wife of Trump's deputy chief of staff Stephen Miller posted a photo implying a U.S. takeover of Greenland, hours after the U.S. attacks on Venezuela.
item.content:encoded:
The wife of Trump's deputy chief of staff Stephen Miller posted a photo implying a U.S. takeover of Greenland, hours after the U.S. attacks on Venezuela.

(Image credit: John Thys)
item.dc:creator: Lydia Calitri

item.title: Here's a partial list of U.S. elected officials opposing Trump's invasion of Venezuela
item.description: Trump's decision to depose Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has drawn praise inside the U.S., especially from Republican leaders. But the invasion also faces significant opposition from elected officials across the political spectrum.
item.content:encoded:
Trump's decision to depose Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has drawn praise inside the U.S., especially from Republican leaders. But the invasion also faces significant opposition from elected officials across the political spectrum.

(Image credit: Julia Demaree Nikhinson)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Venezuela is the latest in the U.S.'s long history of interventions in Latin America
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe talks to Eduardo Gamarra, professor of politics and international relations at Florida International University, about the history of U.S. intervention in Latin America.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe talks to Eduardo Gamarra, professor of politics and international relations at Florida International University, about the history of U.S. intervention in Latin America.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe
